data.title: Introduction: Epiphany and Enquiry
data.meta_description: In the trivial, ugly, sordid, and vulgar, a young James Joyce noted sudden perceptions that he called epiphany. The chatter in a pub, fake condolences, a bit of seaweed on a girl’s thigh—such negligible things unexpectedly lit up in the mind and sparked...
